description:
This module explores the link between macroeconomics, financial markets and policy in Asia, drawing on many analytical tools of macroeconomics and international finance. Topics covered include: capital flows in Asia and policy challenges, foreign exchange hedging and speculation, real exchange rate adjustment and macroeconomic imbalances, Asian financial crisis and its legacies, and opportunities and policy challenges posed by
globalization, regional integration and cross-border transmission of shocks.
title: Macroeconomics and Finance: Perspectives from Asia
prerequisite: None, but knowledge of intermediate macroeconomics is strongly recommended
